body_content.explanation: arranged or decided already and not able to be changed:
examples: Is the date of the wedding fixed yet?

body_content.explanation: A fixed idea is one that someone is not willing to change:
examples: She said, "There is nothing worse than a man who has fixed ideas about what a woman can and cannot do."
Our image of what a leader looks like can sometimes be very fixed.

body_content.explanation: not moving or able to be moved from its position:
examples: Guide stars are fixed points in space used to keep a telescope in position.
It can help your balance if you keep your eyes on a fixed object.

body_content.explanation: (of a look or someone's eyes) not moving from a particular point:
examples: She frightened her younger siblings with a fixed stare.
His eyes were completely fixed on the food.

body_content.explanation: (of a game, result, etc.) dishonestly arranged so that someone gets the result that they want:
examples: He complained that the system was fixed in favour of a certain group of people.
Several players were caught up in a scandal relating to fixed games.
We don't have the problem completely fixed yet.

body_content.explanation: (of an animal) having had part of its sexual organs removed, so that it cannot produce young animals:
examples: Many people find that dogs behave better when they're fixed.
Owners could be fined if they do not get their animals fixed.
